summary: This is an FBI FD-302 form documenting a proffer interview with a witness, Sarah Kellen (referred to as 'Sarah' and identified by initials 'AR'), conducted on March 31, 2020. The witness, a former assistant to Jeffrey Epstein, provides detailed information about message logs, Epstein's operations, the roles of Ghislaine Maxwell and others, the scheduling of massages that often led to sexual encounters, financial payments, and the presence of underage girls. The document reveals the systematic nature of Epstein's activities and the involvement of various associates.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: The primary witness being interviewed. She worked as an assistant for Epstein, scheduling massages, handling messages, and performing various tasks. She describes her own sexual encounters with Epstein and details of the operation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation. Described as receiving massages that led to sexual encounters, having piles of cash, employing staff, and interacting with numerous girls and associates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's former girlfriend who gave instructions to staff, participated in finding girls, and was involved in the operations at his properties.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned in a message about providing a teenage girl for Epstein. Also traveled to Russia to recruit girls.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as having stated he was with his family at Epstein's home, but the witness recalls he was alone when he received a massage.

persons.name: Alfred Rodriguez
persons.context: Identified by initials 'AR' on a message; the witness advises those initials could be his. He had message books in his room.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Recognized as one of Epstein's attorneys in New York. The witness was told by Indyke to contact him if she needed help and to never talk to the police.

persons.name: Henry Jarecki
persons.context: Described as someone Epstein thought of as a friend. The witness saw a picture online of Jarecki with Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in a message; at the time Epstein had a disagreement with his brother about a hospital bill.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Was present in New York during meetings. In New York, Groff scheduled massage appointments.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: Mentioned as someone a girl named 'Sarah' chatted with once.

persons.name: Larry Summers
persons.context: Recalled visiting Epstein's New York house for a very long meeting. The witness helped serve drinks and food.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Recalled having breakfast with Epstein. A young ballerina dancer curtsied when introduced to him.

persons.name: Diane Von Furstenberg
persons.context: Mentioned as the wife of a man Epstein said was gay and needed to spend more time with Sarah and another girl.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of flying into Aspen and going shopping with other girls.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.context: Along with another gentleman, Paul, was grabbing computers and notebooks from Epstein's property. The witness gave items to him.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Along with Janusz Banasiak, was grabbing computers and notebooks. The witness gave items to him.

persons.name: Fidel Castro
persons.context: Mentioned in a recalled Cuba trip where the witness kissed his cheek.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's former girlfriend and actively involved in his operations, including finding girls and giving instructions to staff.
Sarah was Epstein's assistant, performing tasks like scheduling massages and handling messages. She also had sexual encounters with him.
Brunel sent messages about providing teenage girls for Epstein and traveled to recruit girls.
Indyke was one of Epstein's attorneys. He advised the witness to contact him for help and not talk to police.
Maxwell gave tasks and instructions to Sarah. Sarah did not like Maxwell and tried to avoid her.
Groff worked for Epstein, scheduling massage appointments in New York.
Prince Andrew had breakfast with Epstein at his home.
Dershowitz was at Epstein's home and received a massage there.

events.title: Message from Jean Luc Brunel
events.description: A message from Jean Luc Brunel read, 'He has a teacher for you to teach you how to speak Russian. She is 2x8 years old not blonde. Lessons are free and you can have let today if you call.' The witness knew this referenced a teenage girl for Epstein.

events.title: Message referencing school
events.description: A message with identifier SA01446 referenced school. The witness remembered taking the call in reference to scheduling a massage.

events.title: Witness resigns from Epstein
events.description: Sarah Kellen told Epstein she was resigning. Epstein's accountant also resigned around the same time. She received calls from them in 2006 after leaving.

events.title: Prince Andrew's breakfast visit
events.description: Prince Andrew had breakfast with Epstein. A young ballerina dancer curtsied when Epstein introduced her to Prince Andrew.

events.title: Larry Summers meeting at Epstein's home
events.description: Larry Summers visited Epstein's New York house for a very long meeting. The witness helped serve drinks and food.

events.title: Epstein's sexual encounters with witness
events.description: The witness describes sexual encounters with Epstein that were predominantly associated with massages. She states they were consensual but she went along with it even though in her mind she did not want to.

events.title: Epstein's forceful behavior on plane
events.description: A strange situation on a plane where Epstein grabbed the witness by the neck and shook her hard.

events.title: Collection of computers and notebooks
events.description: Janusz Banasiak and Paul were grabbing computers and notebooks from Epstein's property. The witness was instructed to give items to them and later to retrieve them from the island.

locations: Little St. James Island (U.S. Virgin Islands)
301 East 66th Street, New York, NY (studio apartment)
keyFacts: A message from Jean Luc Brunel in 2005 explicitly referenced providing a teenage girl ('2x8 years old') for Jeffrey Epstein, which Ghislaine Maxwell found 'funny' and may have rewritten.
Sarah Kellen, Epstein's assistant, describes that scheduling and confirming massage appointments for Epstein was a regular activity, and these massages often led to sexual encounters.
Epstein kept piles of $100 bills in a duffel bag, and both the girl who brought another girl and the one who gave the massage were paid.
Epstein had a tape recorder that he kept in his bathrobe and duffel bag, and the witness was instructed to shred documents at Maxwell's house.
Epstein's attorney, Darren Indyke, told the witness to contact him if she ever needed help and to never talk to the police.
